1.text: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving favor rather than silver and gold.

2.text: The rich and poor meet together: the LORD is the maker of them all.

3.text: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.

4.text: By humility and the fear of the LORD are riches, and honor, and life.

5.text: Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.

6.text: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.

7.text: The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.

8.text: He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.

9.text: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.

10.text: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall end; yes, strife and reproach shall cease.

11.text: He that loveth pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.

12.text: The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.

13.text: The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.

14.text: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred by the LORD shall fall therein.

15.text: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

16.text: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.

17.text: Bow down thy ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thy heart to my knowledge.

18.text: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keepest them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.

19.text: That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.

20.text: Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,

21.text: That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send to thee?

22.text: Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:

23.text: For the LORD will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.

24.text: Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:

25.text: Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.

26.text: Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.

27.text: If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?

28.text: Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.

29.text: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.
